title: Bob Harper, 'Biggest Loser' Host, Is Recovering From a Heart Attack
text: Lindsey Lanquist Bob Harper, Biggest Loser Host, Is Recovering From a Heart Attack Bob Harper, host of The Biggest Loser , revealed he suffered a heart attack two weeks ago that left him unconscious for two days. Share via Twitter Jared Siskin/Patrick McMullan/Getty Images Bob Harper, host of The Biggest Loser , just revealed he suffered a heart attack two weeks ago, according to TMZ . The 51-year-old was reportedly working out at a gym in New York City when he collapsed. Harper was rushed to the hospital, where he was treated for eight daysâ€”two of which he spent unconscious. Harper has since regained consciousness, and TMZ reports he's doing much better. For the time being, Harper's exercise is limited to walking. The television star has stayed in New York City since the incident because reportedly his doctors have not yet cleared him to fly back to his home in Los Angeles. According to TMZ , a history of heart issues runs in Harper's family. He reportedly told the site that his mother passed away from one.
